definition: (in former times) banknote with a value in silver
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: He doesnt mention paper money and the bank note, which were both invented during the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有提到紙幣和銀票，這是在宋朝發明的。

sentences.english: Mr Yao out twelve thousand silver ticket let younger sister to support the anti-japanese opportunely.
sentences.chinese: 姚先生拿出一萬兩銀票讓巧妹帶去支持抗日。

definition: lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
